verses.plain: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

tokens.t: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

verses.plain: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

tokens.t: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

verses.plain: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

tokens.t: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

verses.plain: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

tokens.t: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

verses.plain: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

tokens.t: A wise
will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

verses.plain: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

tokens.t: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

verses.plain: ¶ The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

tokens.t: ¶ The fear of the
the beginning of knowledge:
fools despise wisdom and instruction.

verses.plain: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

tokens.t: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verses.plain: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

tokens.t: For they
an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

verses.plain: ¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

tokens.t: ¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

verses.plain: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

tokens.t: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

verses.plain: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

tokens.t: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

verses.plain: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

tokens.t: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

verses.plain: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

tokens.t: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

verses.plain: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

tokens.t: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

verses.plain: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

tokens.t: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

verses.plain: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

tokens.t: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

verses.plain: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

tokens.t: And they lay wait for their
blood; they lurk privily for their
lives.

verses.plain: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

tokens.t: So
the ways of every one that is greedy of gain;
taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

verses.plain: ¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

tokens.t: ¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

verses.plain: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

tokens.t: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words,

verses.plain: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

tokens.t: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

verses.plain: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

tokens.t: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

verses.plain: ¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

tokens.t: ¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

verses.plain: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

tokens.t: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

verses.plain: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

tokens.t: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

verses.plain: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

tokens.t: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

verses.plain: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

tokens.t: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

verses.plain: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:

tokens.t: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the

verses.plain: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

tokens.t: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

verses.plain: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

tokens.t: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

verses.plain: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

tokens.t: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

verses.plain: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

tokens.t: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

footnotes.text: the interpretation: or, an eloquent speech
the beginning: or, the principal part
in the…: Heb. in the eyes of every thing that hath a wing
Wisdom: Heb. Wisdoms, that is, Excellent wisdom
turning…: or, ease of the simple
